title: Michal Kvasnička
text:
Selected Papers

Long-distance rail in Europe: Comparing the forms of head-on competition across Europe
BERIA, Paolo, Vardhman LUNKAR, Samuel TOLENTINO, Vilém PAŘIL and Michal KVASNIČKA. Long-distance rail in Europe: Comparing the forms of head-on competition across Europe. Research in Transportation Economics. Oxford: Elsevier, 2023, vol. 102, December, p. 1-17. ISSN 0739-8859. Available from https://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.retrec.2023.101367.




Can we ignore spatial dependence when evaluating mergers?
KVASNIČKA, Michal. Can we ignore spatial dependence when evaluating mergers? Empirical Economics. HEIDELBERG: Springer-Verlag GmbH Germany, 2022, vol. 62, No 3, p. 1323-1344. ISSN 0377-7332. Available from https://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s00181-021-02055-x.




Do R&D Subsidies Support Innovation or Imitation? Evidence from Four EU Countries
STANĚK, Rostislav, Michal KVASNIČKA and Ondřej KRČÁL. Do R&D Subsidies Support Innovation or Imitation? Evidence from Four EU Countries. Ekonomický časopis. SAP - Slovak Academic Press, 2018, vol. 66, No 9, p. 909-924. ISSN 0013-3035.




Is the Retail Gasoline Market Local or National?
KVASNIČKA, Michal, Rostislav STANĚK and Ondřej KRČÁL. Is the Retail Gasoline Market Local or National? Journal of Industry, Competition and Trade. Springer US, 2018, vol. 18, No 1, p. 47-58. ISSN 1566-1679. Available from https://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10842-017-0249-0.




External validity of prospect theory: The evidence from soccer betting
KRČÁL, Ondřej, Michal KVASNIČKA and Rostislav STANĚK. External validity of prospect theory: The evidence from soccer betting. Journal of Behavioral and Experimental Economics. 2016, vol. 65, No 5, p. 121-127. ISSN 2214-8043. Available from https://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.socec.2016.07.005.

title: Michal Kvasnička
text:
Selected Past Projects

Creation of Advanced Traffic Accident Analysis Tools for the Police of the Czech Republic
supported by TAČR grant TL02000122 | for the Police of the Czech Republic | with Štěpán Mikula, Josef Montag, and Josef Bolcha
We developed software to identify and visualize hazardous sections of road networks, and to display general accident statistics. A demonstration version of the software is available here.
Downloads:

hazardous section detection
presentation software





Merger simulation in markets with homogeneous product and spatial differentiation
supported by TAČR grant TL02000122 | for the Office for the Protection of Competition | with Rostislav Staněk and Ondřej Krčál
We developed software MergerSim to analyze fuel market mergers for the Czech Competition Authority. It forecasts price changes (overall and at specific stations) and recommends obligations to maintain competition. This tool aids decision-making in a market prone to mergers. The software is implemented in the R computing environment.
Downloads:

MergerSim: merger simulation and visualization software





Collusion detection in public procurement
supported by TAČR grant TD03000121 | for the Office for the Protection of Competition | with Rostislav Staněk and Ondřej Krčál
This project delivered a methodology and software for the OCA to uncover collusion in public procurement. The system pinpoints suspect contracts and sectors, and the methodology guides the OCA in gathering additional evidence for formal investigations.
Download:

detector: detects behavior suspected of collusion in public procurement
pprobber: downloads data from the new Public Procurement Bulletin
pprobber: downloads data from the old Public Procurement Bulletin

title: Michal Kvasnička

title: Michal Kvasnička
text:
Current Teaching

Principles of Microeconomics
This course, taught in Czech, introduces first-year Faculty of Economics students at Masaryk University to the principles of microeconomics, based on Mankiw’s Principles of Economics. For more information, please visit the course website.




Applied Identification Strategies
Applied Identification Strategies, co-taught with Štěpán Mikula, introduces students to the principles of causal inference using Huntington-Klein’s The Effect as a core text. For more information, please visit the course website.




Analysis and Visualization of Economic Data in R
Students will learn the basics of data analysis and visualization in R through this Czech-language course, co-taught by Štěpán Mikula. We use a custom textbook developed specifically for this course. Visit the course website for more details.

title: Michal Kvasnička
text:
Masaryk University | Department of Economics
Lipová 41a | 60200 Brno | Czech Republic


I am an assistant professor at the Department of Economics of the Faculty of Economics, Masaryk University, and member of Health Economics, Policy, and Innovation Institute (HEPII).
My research focuses on applied microeconomics and health economics.
